lead_paragraph: Matt Ryan signed a six-year, $72 million contract with the Atlanta Falcons on Tuesday, ending concerns that prolonged negotiations could threaten his chance to become the starting quarterback as a rookie. Ryan, the No. 3 pick in last month’s N.F.L. draft out of Boston College, is guaranteed $34.75 million. His guaranteed money is $4.75 million more than that given to Dolphins offensive tackle Jake Long, the No. 1 choice, who is also represented by the agent Tom Condon.
